Articles.Content:
Well, I guess if you call me kidnaping him from his Orbit, high over Kerban... then yea..

I'm a new player and I had been trying to learn the game by doing the contracts. it seems that I should go back to the safer training missions..

But today, after an unknown number of trys and a couple F5, F9, F9, F9 combos, I was able to get within 2KM of my wayward son.

switched to control him only to see my craft SPEEEEEED by... ok..back to mission control, back to space ship.. lets null out the speed to target this time...

Yep... ok F9...dialing into his orbit and matching speed, again within 2k.. swap, Jetpack on.. ..( did I mention i'm new.. I need jetpack time..)

Fly past the ship at a high rate of speed. Swap my camera view... line up...and this time.....this time. I get to the ship. fumble for my latter and tapping F just because I know he is close..

FINALY!!!! I get the ladder and board. No longer must he fly high over the orb wishing he had something to eat or a place to use the bathroom....

I can't wait for the next version... I'm learning, but Man, I really need to get some jetpack time.

v

Ah yes, the joys of learning the game

My first intercepts - or tries at it - was a little dance where my craft zipped by the target again and again. And again.

At some point something will 'click' and you get it. At around the same point you get hopelessly addicted to KSP
